newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-BARCELONA BLAME RONALDO'S AGENTS ON TALKS BREAKDOWN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BARCELONA BLAME RONALDO'S AGENTS ON TALKS BREAKDOWN.

text.p: Barcelona on Friday blamed Ronaldo's agents for the breakdown of talks to renew the Brazilian strikers' contract.

"The conclusion that can be reached from their attitude leads us to believe that the agents are in contact with another club," Barcelona said in a statement, and also described comments made by Ronaldo as 'disinformation'.
Ronaldo looked set to renew his contract with the club on Tuesday, but negotiations broke down the following day.
The club maintained that every condition made by the agents was met.
However the statement stressed that Ronaldo was still a Barcelona player.
Any club wanting to sign the 20-year-old striker will have to pay 4.5 billion pesetas ($32.1 million) to buy him out of his existing contract.
Italy's Inter Milan remain hot favourites to sign Ronaldo, who will miss the rest of the Spanish season through international duty.
